subject: Re: Thou shalt not always write isolated tests (was: [junit] Re: Expected exception pitfall and pattern)
msgSnippet: ... ...unless you re practising TDD, in which case you know exactly where to look: at whatever you just typed. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger ::
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 11/29/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Cedric, but 2 + 2 still going to be 4 and you still will have to
> > investigate why above 10 cases failed...
>
>
> Yes, but you know exactly where to start when you read "1 FAILURE, 9 SKIPS"
> as opposed to "10 FAILURES".

...unless you're practising TDD, in which case you know exactly where to
look: at whatever you just typed.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
